title: What should I do to my air conditioner when the power goes out suddenly to prevent it from any damage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Normally , when power goes out, your stablilizer would absorb the shock of any over or under current. If you see unusual flctuations, just go and power of the main power supply point where your AC wire connects . There is up down switch ;Just put the position to down. Stablizers of reputed company absorbs this kind of power fluctuations generally

Gadgets are getting smarter like our mobiles. So stay assured your AC is smart enough to delay the compressor start by the short nap it needs before resuming work. But honestly, the smart appliances are not street smart. All they need is to be protected from under/over voltage beyond their rating and please do implement that. Got it?
